subject: Personal Finance
title: Keeping Up with the Joneses
description: A 60-second lesson on Keeping Up with the Joneses.

hook.text: Your neighbor buys a new car. Suddenly your perfectly fine car feels inadequate. Comparison strikes.

buildup.text: Social comparison drives spending. We measure our wealth relative to peers, not in absolute terms.

discovery.text: Studies show people prefer earning $50K when peers earn $40K over earning $100K when peers earn $200K.

twist.text: Social media amplifies this. We compare our everyday life to everyone else's highlight reel.

climax.text: Many high-earners are broke because they spend to match their social circle. Income doesn't equal wealth.

punchline.text: The Joneses are probably in debt too.

quiz.question: How do people typically measure their own wealth?
